FuncDef: The display mac-address aging-time bridge-domain command displays the aging time for dynamic MAC address entries in a specified bridge domain (BD).

ParaDef.Info:
Displays the aging time for dynamic MAC entries in a bridge domain with a specified ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After multiple bridge domains are configured on a device, to view the aging time for dynamic MAC address entries in a specified bridge domain, run the display mac-address aging-time bridge-domain command in the BD view. To set the aging time, run the mac-address aging-time (Bridge domain view) command. The command output helps verify the configuration and analyze faults.
Precautions
If a MAC address entry does not age, the aging time in the command output is 0s.
If a great number of bridge domains are configured on a device, configure bd-id in the display mac-address aging-time bridge-domain command to view information about a specified bridge domain.
